results.title: The Good, the bad and the ugly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Produzioni Europee Associati, Alberto Grimaldi and Sergio Leone
results.brief_description: During the Civil War a mysterious nomad (Clint Eastwood) enters a macabre business partnership with a Mexican gunman (Eli Wallach), a man with a price on his head. Eastwood turns him in to the authorities, collects the reward money, and at the last minute, rescues him so that they can begin the whole process again. They make quite a good living doing this until they form an uneasy alliance with a sadistic criminal (Lee Van Cleef), and this time, the stakes are much higher. This film is the third and arguably the best of Sergio Leone’s westerns set during the Civil War. With a memorable score by Ennio Morricone and excellent cast, this is the quintessential “Spaghetti Western”.

results.title: The Good Earth
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irving G. Thalberg and Sidney A. Franklin
results.brief_description: Set in pre-revolutionary China, Paul Muni plays Wang Lung, a simple peasant farmer who rises to become a prosperous lord. Tragedy pursues him as he betrays his family and neglects the earth he has worshipped. Luise Rainer won an Academy Award for her portrayal of O-Lan, Wang’s devoted wife, a battered slave who grows into a proud, loyal woman. Based on Pearl S. Buck’s Pulitzer Prize winning novel.

results.title: The Gold Rush (1925)
results.brief_description: The Gold Rush, an immortal classic, is regarded as one of Chaplin’s very best films, interweaving to brilliant effect the pathetic tale of the Tramp’s apparently hopeless love for a dancehall girl with the funny story of the Tramp and his burly gold prospecting partner heading off to make their fortunes in the great Yukon gold rush. Through the entire film hangs Chaplin’s finely perceived view of the contrast between the Tramp’s selfless, humanitarian behaviour, and the unpleasant, brutish life of the gold town society. Rated: G

results.title: The Gods must be crazy
results.creator_credit: C A T Films and Jamie Uys
results.brief_description: Uys, a South African filmmaker, produced, directed and wrote this delightful, almost slapstick comedy about gentle Kalahari bushman Xi, who sets off on a trek to the ends of the earth to destroy a Coca Cola bottle which the “gods” had thrown from the sky. This ‘gift’ threatens to destroy the usual peace and happiness of the tribe. On his journey he unexpectedly collides with the modern world in the form of ruthless terrorists, a schoolteacher and a bumbling scientist studying elephant dung. ‘The Gods must be crazy’ is a comic fable which can be enjoyed by all ages.

results.title: The Godfather [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Albert Ruddy and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s epic masterpiece features Oscar winner Marlon Brando as the patriarch of the Corleone family. Coppola paints a chilling portrait of a Sicilian family’s rise and near fall from power in America, and the passage of rites from father to son. He masterfully balances the story between family life and the ugly business of crime in which they are engaged. Based on Mario Puzo’ best selling novel, this graphic and brilliant film garnered ten Academy Award nominations. Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

results.title: The Glenrowan affair
results.creator_credit: Australian Motion Pictures and Rupert Kathner
results.brief_description: This film, based on the Ned Kelly legend, was filmed in and around Benalla by a specialist in low budget quickies with a local football hero, Bob Chitty as Ned. Told from the perspective of an ageing Dan Kelly in present day Benalla, the narrative is presented as a factual retelling of the exploits of the Kelly gang despite its obvious embellishment of the Kelly myth. The shortcomings of the script and its clumsy realisation were derided by the Benalla audience at its premiere and noted by press reviewers upon its brief Sydney release. Narrated by Charles Tingwell. Cast includes: Bob Chitty, Albie Henderson, Ben Crowe, Bill Wright, John Fernside, Chas. Tasman, Charles Webb, Edward Smith, Frank Ransom, Stan Tolhurst. Photography, Harry Malcolm ; editor, Alex Ezard ; sound, Berry Hallett.

results.title: The Glenn Miller story
results.creator_credit: Universal International Pictures, Aaron Rosenberg and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: This bio-pic is the story of legendary (real-life) American big band leader Glenn Miller. Miller was a visionary who introduced swing music to American audiences in the 1940s with his own original compositions. Starting in the 1930s “The Glen Miller story” tracks Miller’s struggles to have his arrangements played when the mood of the day was for the standards only. Miller was a talented trombonist who was driven by a love of music to champion the case for a new style of writing. The film also tells the story of Miller wooing his teenage sweetheart, whom he eventually marries. Helen (June Allyson) frequently played second fiddle to Miller’s ambitions, even spending her wedding night at a club whilst Miller jammed with Louis Armstrong. The film features many musicians of the era playing themselves which greatly enhances its appeal. Musicians include: Louis Armstrong, Gene Krupa, Barney Biggard, Arvell Shaw and Frances Langford. “The Glenn Miller story” was one of the most successful bio-pics of its day. Starring James Stewart as Miller, the film was nominated for five Academy Awards in 1954, winning one for best sound.

results.title: The Girl on a motorcycle = La Motocyclette
results.creator_credit: Mid Atlantic Film, Ares Production, William Sassoon and Jack Cardiff
results.brief_description: Girl on a motorcycle is an erotic fantasy film starring Marianne Faithful and Alain Delon. Rebecca (Faithful) is a bored English newly wed, whose husband fails to satisfy her emotionally or sexually. On a whim Rebecca flees to France on her motorcycle to be re-united with her former lover Daniel (Delon), who taught her a love of riding and gave her sexual satisfaction. Numerous flashback sequences reveal the history between Rebecca and Daniel. Whilst riding to meet Daniel, Rebecca (in voiceover) ruminates over the motivation behind her choices and the possibilities of her future. The film was released in 1968 in an edited version that was X-rated, under the title “Naked under leather”. This is the full length uncut version. In keeping with the times, the film features several psychedelic scenes.

results.title: The Girl can't help it
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Frank Tashlin
results.brief_description: This wonderfully farcical comedy is the first big budget rock and roll movie of the fifties and features seventeen great songs of the era. Tom Ewell plays a down and out agent who is hired by a mobster to make a star out of his sex-pot girlfriend (Jayne Mansfield). Ewell gives her a rock and roll act in the hope of making the big time but Jayne yearns for the simple life and complications set in when she falls for Ewell, while searching for the perfect husband. Includes Little Richard, Eddie Cochran, Gene Vincent, Platters, Fats Domino and more. Also stars Edmond O’Brien.
